tweet:
I have heard the impassioned pleas from my constituents and people, especially young people, from around the country.

That is why I support a Green New Deal.

We must take truly bold action against climate change, for our youth and for generations yet unborn.

I applaud @NancyPelosi for forming a Select Committee on the Climate Crisis. This Committee must address climate change for what it is: a public health crisis, a matter of economic justice, and an existential threat.

We must deliver real solutions, not piecemeal suggestions. https://twitter.com/SpeakerPelosi/status/1078690755194118144 …
My thoughts and prayers are with Marlene's family and friends as they mourn her passing.

Marlene and Stewart joined me over 20 years ago in founding the Elijah Cummings Youth Program, which has strengthened the bonds between youth in Israel and African American children in the 7th Congressional District of Maryland.
Marlene dedicated her life not only to fighting cancer, but also to uplifting the young people in our community.

In 1996, Marlene and her husband Stewart donated a record $10 million to the University of Maryland’s cancer center, which is now named the University of Maryland Marlene and Stewart Greenebaum Comprehensive Cancer Center in their honor.
After a battle with cancer, Marlene dedicated herself to ensuring that everyone in Baltimore had access to cancer care regardless of their zip code or wealth.

I am saddened to learn of the passing of Marlene Greenebaum. Marlene was a devoted member of the Baltimore community who constantly and generously brought life to life. https://www.baltimoresun.com/news/obituaries/bs-md-ob-marlene-greenebaum-20181224-story.html …

I want to wish everyone a festive, happy, and healthy holiday season! During this week of celebration, I ask that we think of everything with which we have been blessed, and to consider those who are less fortunate. Season’s Greetings, and Happy New Year! pic.twitter.com/M56rqInVH6

Our nation’s public servants working or furloughed during this shutdown deserve the peace of mind of knowing they will be paid. I am pleased to cosponsor and support bipartisan legislation in the House that ensures federal employees affected by a shutdown receive retroactive pay.

However, the President and Congressional Republicans decided to proceed with this shutdown because of the President's demand that taxpayers foot the bill for his border wall; the same wall the President promised the American people they would not have to pay to build.
This shutdown was completely avoidable, and Congressional Democrats offered multiple options to keep the government open.

At midnight, President Trump and Congressional Republicans forced the government to partially shut down.  Because of this shutdown, over 800,000 federal employees will go without pay over the holiday season.

Read my full statement:  https://cummings.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/cummings-statement-partial-government-shutdown …

The Trump administration’s proposal for stricter SNAP work requirements would hurt over 700,000 Americans. Congress already rejected harsher SNAP work requirements when we passed the #FarmBill. The Trump administration should not take food assistance away from those who need it. https://twitter.com/AP/status/1075797560282017792 …
The MERCY Act takes a strong step toward eliminating this barbaric practice, to ensure our youth have a chance to be rehabilitated and become contributing members of their communities.

I am pleased that my bill, The MERCY Act, was included in the final bill. Compounding incarceration with solitary confinement can break a young person’s spirit beyond repair, and it can have devastating long-term impacts on their mental and physical health.

Today, I voted in favor of the First Step Act. This bill – as its name states – is just the beginning of needed reforms to our federal criminal justice system. 

Read my full statement:  https://cummings.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/cummings-statement-passage-first-step-act …
Through supporting social justice initiatives in their backyard, the @Ravens continue to prove their commitment to the Baltimore community.

The $500,000 that the @Ravens have donated to organizations in the Baltimore area this past month is remarkable. I thank the players and the team for their contributions. https://twitter.com/Ravens/status/1075103787629641728 …

Congratulations to Max Hollis & Jeff Yang of @hcpss_mrhs! Max & Jeff are the winners of the #MD07 2018 @CongressionalAC. Their app informs people of the atmospheric conditions in their communities to increases public awareness about the impact of pollution. pic.twitter.com/pPG8DJw5jO
I was on @CNNSotu with @jaketapper this morning! Check out my interview here:  https://youtu.be/X2TTqcD-jRs  pic.twitter.com/YLEZa7kpIY
I will be on @CNNSotu with @jaketapper during the 9:00 hour. Tune in!

Today is the last day to sign up for a 2019 health insurance plan. Don’t miss your chance to #GetCovered through @MarylandConnect! Head to  http://marylandhealthconnection.gov  or call 1-855-642-8572 and sign up now! The consumer support center will be open until 10:00 P.M. tonight.

This cruel decision will create fear for the millions of Americans who rely on the ACA’s protection. I pledge to do everything in my power to protect the ACA and the lifesaving care it provides to Americans, especially those with pre-existing conditions. https://twitter.com/washingtonpost/status/1073751190838611968 …

There is only one day left to #GetCovered by signing up for a health insurance plan during @MarylandConnect’s Open Enrollment period! Sign up now by heading to  http://marylandhealthconnection.gov  or by calling 1-855-642-8572.

I am honored that the readers and Editorial Board of the @BaltimoreSun selected me as one of five finalists for the 2018 Marylander of the Year award. I congratulate my fellow finalists, and I commend their valuable contributions to our State. https://twitter.com/baltimoresun/status/1073573355423457281 …
I was with @SenWarren and @morganpres David Wilson at @MorganStateU's December Commencement this morning. Congratulations to the Class of 2018! pic.twitter.com/KvS5ahGIGg

I am heartbroken by this news, and my prayers are with the girl’s family. America is better than this, and we must ensure this can never happen again. https://twitter.com/washingtonpost/status/1073378638949703680 …

I spoke on the House floor today to remind everyone that the Open Enrollment period to sign up for 2019 health plans on @HealthCareGov, and through @MarylandConnect, ends in just 3 days on Saturday, December 15. I urge you to sign up today! pic.twitter.com/XFVjCVSYQS

I commend the House and Senate for coming together to agree on the #FarmBill. I will support this bipartisan bill because it aids our nation's farmers while rejecting even more stringent work requirements for SNAP beneficiaries.

.@NancyPelosi, I am honored to have your recommendation to serve as Chairman of the Oversight and Government Reform Committee. 

Government must work for the people, and I will focus my Chairmanship on improving the lives of Americans in real and meaningful ways.

Today, the President said: "I will shut down the government."

Mr. President, I urge you to work with Congress to avoid this unnecessary and harmful shutdown. The American people deserve better than this. https://twitter.com/NBCNews/status/1072550120187678720 …
“Healthcare is a right, not a privilege.”
“The website is  http://MarylandHealthConnection.gov , and the phone number is 1-855-642-8572.”
“I urge you all to contact @MarylandConnect in the next five days to get the best plan for your needs.”
“I want to make one thing clear - the ACA is going nowhere.”
“Again, I want to reiterate that there are only five days left before the December 15 deadline to buy health insurance.”
“Because of the ACA, Marylanders do not have to live with the daily fear of the financial disaster they could face if they got sick while they were uninsured.”
“When we in Congress passed the ACA in 2010, we enshrined into law the promise that all Americans will have the right to accessible, affordable health insurance coverage in this country.”

“We are here today because we want to make sure, without question, that everyone knows the Open Enrollment period to sign up for 2019 health plans ends in just five days on Saturday, December 15.” pic.twitter.com/xl2Btt595O

Brightwood Students, you have options. You may be eligible for discharge of your federal student loans. 
   
Learn more:  https://studentaid.ed.gov/sa/repay-loans/forgiveness-cancellation/closed-school … https://twitter.com/wjz/status/1070415014702526464 …

Allegations of election fraud and foul play by GOP campaign operatives in NC’s 9th Congressional District are extremely troubling. Congressional GOP should join us in demanding a thorough investigation and that every vote is counted.

I commend the @UofMaryland and @PresidentLoh for persevering through tragedy as a community and hiring a coach that is nationally recognized for his ability to develop the whole student and turn young men into leaders on and off the field.
Coach Mike Locksley is the right man for the @TerpsFootball head coach position. With him in place, the healing and growth needed can begin.

I commend the @Ravens for speaking up about what matters to them & what affects our communities, particularly by urging Congress to move forward with criminal justice reform. Democracy depends on all community members being involved with the decisions being made on their behalf. https://twitter.com/baltimoresun/status/1067629208988524545 …
Information about who is here tonight: pic.twitter.com/Ev8PY7Ua9p

My #HowtoPayforCollege Seminar is happening now at @MICA. Schools and financial aid programs are here to provide you with information and answer your questions. The financial aid panel will start at 6:30 PM.  http://bit.ly/2A12G8w

Today I joined the @Ravens players & team representatives who provided $190,000 to upgrade HVAC units at @BaltCitySchools Lakewood Elementary to provide reliable heating & cooling. I commend & celebrate the commitment of the @Ravens & @NFL to the community & to social justice. pic.twitter.com/vB8R0fBCSX

Trying to figure out how to pay for college? Learn about the resources available to you at my annual How to Pay for College Seminar tomorrow at @MICA. Visit  https://bit.ly/2A12G8w  to find out more and RSVP.

There are two weeks left to sign up for a health insurance plan during the Open Enrollment period! Head to  http://marylandhealthconnection.gov   or call 1-855-642-8572 and #GetCovered before December 15!

A dedicated servant to the nation throughout his life President Bush fought valiantly during World War II to return home and commit himself to a life of dedicated and outstanding public service to a grateful nation. My prayers are with the Bush family.
I join the country in mourning the loss of President George H.W. Bush.
